attributes.action: Rape including statutory rape needs to be educated in schools.

men

And survivors face long waits for their cases to reach a courtroom
After being reported to the police, adult rape cases take an average of 2 years to complete in court – with many taking far longer.
attributes.background: It should be necessary to teach children about rape culture and the true meaning of rape and consent from a young age. Many don’t understand that “no” means no, and early education can prevent sexual violence before it happens.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept your petition, as there is already an expectation in secondary school that the issue of consent is taught. Please see this website for more information:
https://www.gov.uk/government/publications/relationships-education-relationships-and-sex-education-rse-and-health-education/relationships-and-sex-education-rse-secondary

You could submit a new petition explaining how the current guidance should change.
